body.name: Notorious: Steamy Historical Romance Novel, A Rake Regency Romance Book 1 - Corrupting The Innocent

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank
productInformation.value: #18,743 in Kindle Store (See Top 100 in Kindle Store) #21 in Renaissance Historical Romance (Books) #23 in Renaissance Historical Romance (Kindle Store) #244 in Victorian Historical Romance (Kindle Store)

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Excerpts from NOTORIOUS: The debut novel in a Regency Romance series by English author - Katherine Harlow “He studied every movement, every gesture. The way she tilted her head, exposed her neck, touched her hair. As much as she maintained her innocence and chastity through her words, those subtle unconscious signals betrayed her true feelings. They whispered to him, quietly but persistently. It is was not him alone who felt the pull of temptation. Miss Stratton could be… corrupted.” "Let him go on and she would no doubt be consumed, body and soul. Her breath was gone. Her heart was heavy. In the end, she restrained him with only the appeal of an outstretched hand."

You've never read a steamy Historical Romance quite like this... Quotes from Readers: "Like a hunter stalking his prey, he coldly plotted her ruination. I don't believe that I've ever read anything like this in a romance before." "This was a very intriguing peek inside the mind of a rake, and I was there for it. How a rake thinks and behaves once he sets his sights on a woman; the plotting and manipulation, his fine ability to say and do just the right thing. Hugh was a true regency-era playa and I loved this part of the book." "I've have never blushed and smiled, thrown my hands up in frustration as much as I have reading a book as I ever did with this. This tale is seductive, sultry, and sexy. I want more of the Viscount." "Some of it is absolutely heart wrenching but the HEA (happy ever after) is tremendous!"

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Full of passion, heartbreak, and true honorable romance. I couldn't put it down. This is a quick read that was full of angst, wit, and light spice. I thoroughly enjoyed this tale.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Notorious I say
reviews.reviewText: There is a truly dastardly villain in this book but it is understated till the end. Love prevails in this case.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I loved this book
reviews.reviewText: Such a beautiful love story.I highly recommend this book, it will keep you captivated and wondering what will happen next.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was an okay read for me, the cover is delicious though. 😍 recency fans will love it! Great job.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I enjoyed this!
reviews.reviewText: Finished in one sitting! I really enjoyed this book. It had a good plot, characters were well written and I’m fully invested in them! I can’t wait to read the next book. My “criticism” would be that I would have liked a little bit more interaction between the love interests when they were building their relationship, but also understand the constraints of the time period. I also feel like the male lead was a little forceful at some points. Even though we were getting the female POV, he was not and I felt he took liberties without explicit consent , personally preference though. I did like the twist and resolution at the end. Very interested to see how the next book goes. Hoping for a story with Anne! She ended up being one of my favorite characters!**I received an advance review copy for free, and I am leaving this review voluntarily.**

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Notorious is steamy
reviews.reviewText: Started to read and couldn't put it down. Plot twists of who is a rake and who is not. I loved the characters and can't wait to read their future stories. Kept the story line to the times it is written in, it showed unmarried with a child was so looked down on. Thank goodness for how times have changed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars One Viscount Hugh Rochford, please!
reviews.reviewText: This was my first historical romance, and I..I am at a loss for words. Finished this book in one day. The writing, the characters, everything was on a whole other level for me. I have a very, VERY short list of 5 star books, and I knew this book would be 5 stars 30% of the way through. If I finish a book, and can't stop thinking about it...it's five stars.Katherine's writing is incredible. I could not stop reading - her descriptions and her way with words are amazing. I have never swooned so hard for a character. Grahh!!! I mean, the book didn't have many spicy scenes, but, I couldn't catch my breath when they were getting steamy at the Duchess' house. Holy goodness.Viscount Hugh Rochford. Ahh, he has my affections, as well as Penelope's. My new book husband. It's difficult to NOT fall in love with this man. Who he was and how others perceived him - a true rake. But, he was but a man who had to grow up quickly to keep his life from falling apart. Rochford is a 5 star man for me.Penelope, though young, innocent and naive, captures you at the onset. She is smart and obviously has a good head on her shoulders. A bright and sunny girl who falls in love with a questionable, "wondrously handsome" Viscount.I am now a devoted Katherine Harlow fan. I cannot wait for the remaining books.Also, some say that this book isn't historically accurate, but I wouldn't know. I don't read books for time accuracy. If I wanted that, I'd read history books - and even those are questionable. I'm here for romance - even better if there's smut.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Notorious Lord & Bold Debutant
reviews.reviewText: A rakish Lord + a smart and bold debutant in Regency Britain… Notorious is a fun and clever take on this trope. Viscount Hugo Rochford and the Honorable Penelope Stratton do not seem like a wise match. He’s got a terrible reputation as a womanizer and hasn’t been interested in marriage and Penelope wants to marry for love and an educated sense of right and wrong. Hugo does Penelope a favor but introducing her cousin Anne to a former school friend and a terrific match is made for both. Now Hugo starts to think that Penelope is a terrific a match for him but her family hears a terrible story about him and his former fiancé. Her parents decidedly steer her in a different direction and Hugo is honor bound to correct the story. I enjoyed this book and will read the next installment once it’s published.
Good classic, historical romance. Can't wait to read more by this author!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the Netherlands on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It took a while for the story to get going, but afterward my patience was rewarded more than enough. I occasionally got Pride And Prejudice vibes. Nice twist at the end. I read it in one sitting. Highly recommended.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 28, 2023
reviews.reviewText: You know that mouthwatering moment when you eat a rich, chocolate torte? Well that’s this book for me. Sublime. It’s very well written an amazing debut. With a refreshing style and voice. The only thing wrong though…….no back log to devour!I would not change one thing in the actual story it was down to Earth but had a dark, mysterious, fairytale quality to it. Misunderstood anti hero and plucky heroine. I read it in one sitting. The mark of an amazing book is the fact I’m still mulling over it three days later. Actually thinking of rereading it again which I never do usually. Do yourself a favour and gorge on utter perfection…..it’s totally worth it.I’m not surprised it’s climbing Amazon Bestseller listing. Best book for me of 2023.Oh, whoever chose the front cover and second picture nailed it. Exactly as I imagined Hugo and Penelope would look. They are both perfectly written, well matched characters with depth to them. I was so engrossed with these two.Ms Harlow where have you been hiding your talents? I for one cannot wait for the next instalment of this series! I’ll be waiting impatiently (sorry) for whatever morsel you choose to publish next.
I really struggled to finish this book. I found it very boring at times and was skimming the pages.

You know when all those booktokkers and bookstagrammers say they always picture Henry Cavill as the MMC? ... Yeah, I can't say I thought anyone would actually put him on the cover??It's still a fun read, and I enjoyed it a lot.
